name: Homeless and Housing Coalition of Kentucky
description: The Homeless and Housing Coalition of Kentucky (HHCK) is a statewide coalition of partners and advocates working to end homelessness and create opportunities for low-income Kentuckians to live in affordable homes. Since 1987, HHCK has advocated at the federal and state levels of government for housing needs and opportunities for low-income Kentuckians and member organizations. Services include coordinated entry for housing assistance, housing programs, advocacy and policy work, research and resources, and membership support for housing organizations across Kentucky.
source: Verified from official website, multiple online directories, and government sources
eligibility: Kentucky residents and organizations seeking housing assistance, advocacy, or coalition membership
cost_information: Varies by service - some services free, membership fees may apply
notes: Statewide coalition that coordinates housing services and advocates for affordable housing policy. Provides coordinated entry for housing assistance and supports member organizations across Kentucky.
